TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit Rect3D extends System.ValueType implements class System.IFormattable

Docs.summary: Represents a 3-D rectangle: for example, a cube.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is defined as a location (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D>) and a size structure (<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D>). Because the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Z%2A> values specified for the size are magnitudes and not coordinates, they cannot be negative except in the case of an empty rectangle. An empty rectangle is specified by <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Empty%2A>, which has <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Z%2A> values of -Infinity.
This structure is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property returns an empty <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> whose X, Y, and Z values are positive-infinity and whose size values are negative infinity. This is the only situation in which size values can be negative.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a that represents the origin of the .
Docs.value: that represents the origin of the , typically the back bottom left corner. The default value is (0,0,0).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Note that in the 3-D coordinate system, the positive Y axis points up (assuming that the camera's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ProjectionCamera.UpDirection%2A> property is positive). Therefore, this property usually represents the back bottom left corner of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> in the scene.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.

Docs.summary: Sets the offset translation of the to the provided value, specified as a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
Note that calling the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Offset%2A> method will only have an effect if you can change the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Y%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Z%2A> properties directly. Because <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is a value type, if you reference a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> object by using a property or indexer, you get a copy of the object, not a reference to the object. If you attempt to change <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.X%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Y%2A>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Z%2A> on a property or indexer reference, a compiler error occurs. Similarly, calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D.Offset%2A> on the property or indexer will not change the underlying object. If you want to change the value of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> that is referenced as a property or indexer, create a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D>, modify its fields, and then assign the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> back to the property or indexer.

## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> is typically used to represent the bounds of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Size3D> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D> are not typically used in XAML, because no settable properties exist in the WPF 3D object model that use those types.
